Package com.min.utilities.convert

Class GUIConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • com.min.utilities.convert.GUIConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class GUIConverter
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Build a concrete class inheriting the Swing JFrame. The layout of the components reference to Windows 10 intrinsic converter application Four types of Swing layouts were used to fulfill the layout intension. BorderLayout is used to set the general layout of four JPanels FlowLayout is used to set the header JPanel BoxLayout is used to set the display JPanel GridLayout is used to set the button JPanel Worker method createEventHandlers() is the core of the class, where events of all JComponents (click, change of property) were handled with appropriate actions as intended.
    Since:
    11.0.1
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Min Yang
    See Also:
    PropertyChangeEvent, PropertyChangeListener, Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void createEventHandlers()
      Core worker method to the whole application For each JComponent, corresponding event handler is bound to them, by calling the proper event listener
      void evaluate()
      The ultimate function to compute the value of 'to' unit, by calling the overridden worker methods convertUnits() The implementation of convertUnits() method depends on the type of current(selected) class (Length, Temperature or Weight...).
      void initJComponents()
      Declare and initialize all required JComponents
      void setDefaultFromToUnitPairOnLoad()

      • createEventHandlers

        public void createEventHandlers()
        Core worker method to the whole application For each JComponent, corresponding event handler is bound to them, by calling the proper event listener

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate()
        The ultimate function to compute the value of 'to' unit, by calling the overridden worker methods convertUnits() The implementation of convertUnits() method depends on the type of current(selected) class (Length, Temperature or Weight...). This is the core method of realizing polymorphism
